properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 26 at 4:14PM AKST until January 27 at 7:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations
of 4 to 8 inches, with locally higher amounts near Whittier.
Winds gusting 35 to 45 mph at times in Seward and Whittier.

* WHERE...Whittier, Seward, and along the Seward Highway.

* WHEN...From 5 AM to 7 PM AKST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of snow and blowing snow
may reduce visibility as low as one quarter of a mile at times
as gusty westerly winds in Whittier and northerly winds in
Seward continue through Monday. Wind gusts will also
occasionally reduce visibility along the Seward Highway,
especially through Turnagain Pass. Any accumulating snow will
also be easily resuspended by fast moving vehicles,
substantially reduce visibilities.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit
511.alaska.gov.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 7 PM AKST MONDAY
